commit_message:
Convergence simulator test scenarios

- https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/convergence-simulator-tests

Change-Id: I6143ef7eee1e04048bcf9bd1b96826d1cc627a9c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/07/152307/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst . Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, see http://www.tele3.cz/jbar/rest/rest.html ============================= Port tests from convergence simulator ============================= Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/convergence-simulator-tests Problem description =================== In coming up with the design of convergence, we built a simulator that verifies a substantial number of test scenarios. The scenarios are defined in what amounts to a simple DSL. If we can run the exact same scenarios against the real Heat code base, then we can not only verify that our convergence implementation fullfills the requirements of the simulator but also continue to do that over time, even as we add more scenarios and even if we still have the need to rapidly prototype design changes in the simulator. Proposed change =============== Implement a stub for the RPC APIs that puts messages into in-memory queues that are drained by an event loop. Implement a fake resource type that uses an in-memory store to represent the underlying physical resource. Provide wrappers for the global inputs to the scenario - `reality`, `verify`, `Template`, `RsrcDef`, `GetRes`, `GetAtt`, `engine`, `converger` - that allow them to be backed by the real equivalent classes in Heat. Finally, reimplement https://github.com/zaneb/heat-convergence-prototype/blob/resumable/test_converge.py using testtools primitives and passing the wrappers above as globals, rather than those defined in https://github.com/zaneb/heat-convergence-prototype/blob/resumable/converge/__init__.py#L24-L41 Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: ishant-tyagi Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Kilo-3 Work Items ---------- - Implement RPC stub and event loop - Implement fake TestResource type and backend simulator - Implement wrappers to map the scenario DSL to real Heat classes - Implement a unit test framework to run the scenarios Dependencies ============ - https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/convergence-message-bus Of course, few of these tests are going to pass until Phase 1 of convergence is substantially complete.

commit_message:
Remove stevenk from users

stevenk is in tripleo-cd-admins. This causes an issue when using
deploy-ci-overcloud as the user is duplicated causing an error.

commit_message:
Test StructuredConfig validate more completely

We need to test that validate() works on StructuredConfig with
get_input. This adds a test that just makes sure the built resource
validates.

We will build on top of this in a later patch to ensure that get_input
can be used as an argument for intrinsic functions.

Change-Id: I166742ef6cb67db1ccce3f3cc06f218d3286760c
Related-Bug: #1344284

commit_message:
Implements: blueprint Implement a container set for database control

Previously, the database container was configured for use with
Kubernetes. This patch removed any k8s dependencies, adds a script
to manage mysql server.cnf settings and splits data and app
containers. Splitting the containers provides additional
portability and operational efficiencies compared to host mounts.

Change-Id: Ie5487e095d91e603a368e8324ba788b26fa28478

added_lines: @staticmethod def _authorize_user(cnxt, handler): if handler(cnxt.user_id, 'user'): return handler(access_key, 'ec2') def _authorize_stack_user(self, cnxt, stack, resource_name): ''' Filter access to describe_stack_resource for stack in-instance users - The user must map to a User resource defined in the requested stack - The user resource must validate OK against any Policy specified ''' def handler(cred, access_type): return stack.access_allowed(cred, resource_name) self._authorize_user(cnxt, handler) def _authorize_resource_user(self, cnxt, resource): def handler(cred, access_type): return resource.check_metadata_access(access_type=access_type, value=cred) self._authorize_user(cnxt, handler) resource = db_api.resource_get_by_name_and_stack(cnxt, resource_name, stack_identity) if cfg.CONF.heat_stack_user_role in cnxt.roles: if not self._authorize_resource_user(cnxt, resource): if cfg.CONF.use_full_stack_access_handlers: logger.warning(_("Falling back to low performance full" " stack access handler.")) s = self._get_stack(cnxt, stack_identity) stack = parser.Stack.load(cnxt, stack=s) if not self._authorize_stack_stack_user(cnxt, stack, resource_name): logger.warning(_("Access denied to resource %s") % resource_name) raise exception.Forbidden() else: logger.warning(_("Access denied to resource %s") % resource_name) raise exception.Forbidden() if not resource: return api.format_stack_resource(resource)
deleted_lines: def _authorize_stack_user(self, cnxt, stack, resource_name): ''' Filter access to describe_stack_resource for stack in-instance users - The user must map to a User resource defined in the requested stack - The user resource must validate OK against any Policy specified ''' if stack.access_allowed(cnxt.user_id, resource_name): return stack.access_allowed(access_key, resource_name) s = self._get_stack(cnxt, stack_identity) stack = parser.Stack.load(cnxt, stack=s) if cfg.CONF.heat_stack_user_role in cnxt.roles: if not self._authorize_stack_user(cnxt, stack, resource_name): logger.warning(_("Access denied to resource %s") % resource_name) raise exception.Forbidden() if resource_name not in stack: resource = stack[resource_name] return api.format_stack_resource(stack[resource_name])

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-09 21:32:53.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resource.py', 'heat/tests/test_resource.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/fd56eedaf029e19ba2c65c7b3ac0d1c701c63451', 'message': "Add methods to store and check access to Metadata

We have the ability to register an access handler currently, but this
makes it so that the entire stack must be parsed just to read Metadata.

We are going to deprecate the arbitrary handler ability once we have
the ability to register specific keys that are granted access. Then we

commit_message:
Add methods to store and check access to Metadata

We have the ability to register an access handler currently, but this
makes it so that the entire stack must be parsed just to read Metadata.

We are going to deprecate the arbitrary handler ability once we have
the ability to register specific keys that are granted access. Then we
won't need to parse the entire stack just to display metadata.

Change-Id: I886ef2d4f2c228d5b286927fb843915961ef1e17
Related-Bug: #1306743

commit_message:
Configure auth_token middleware for Ironic

Ironic re-uses specific values from the keystone_authtoken middleware group,
so currently fails when using this values. This fixes it.

Change-Id: I2bdd0236eced9b567eb2d44d10614c51ea5226dd

commit_message:
Fail when no tests are run

Currently when testr fails to list any tests, no tests are run, so none
fail so the tempest script exits with success.

This patch adds some error handling around testr list-tests so that
errors are output to the console and the script halts on error.

There are also two tests added to check that full_test_list and
test_list are not empty.

Change-Id: I5055759a7d63d1f3a52cc60c6f29e541871ce238
Closes-Bug: #1425318
(cherry picked from commit d118d94abc90b9c947923522841794c2a48ff3e1)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/63/159163/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: testr_ouput_lines=${testr_output_lines:-100}exit_msg(){ echo $1 exit $2 } grep $test_list_name <<<$available_test_lists ||\ exit_msg "$test_list_name is not a valid test list, available test lists: $available_test_lists" 1# Get list of available tests. # lines 1-$testr_ouput_lines are output to stdout, all lines are written to # full_test_list. set -o pipefail testr list-tests |tee >(sed -n 1,${testr_ouput_lines}p) >full_test_list ||\ exit_msg "Failed to generate test list" $? set +o pipefail # Check the full test list is not empty [[ -s full_test_list ]] || exit_msg "No tests found" 1 # Write filter test list using selected function. The full test list is # pre-filtered to only include test lines, this saves adding that filter to # every test list function. grep '^tempest\.' < full_test_list | gen_test_list_${test_list_name} > test_list # Check the filtered test list is not empty [[ -s test_list ]] || exit_msg "No tests remain after filtering" 1
deleted_lines: grep $test_list_name <<<$available_test_lists || { echo "$test_list_name is not a valid test list, available test lists: " echo $available_test_lists exit 1 }# Get list of available tests testr list-tests > full_test_list # Write filter test list using selected function gen_test_list_$test_list_name <full_test_list >test_list

commit_message:
Copy image from source host when ImageNotFound

This patch builds on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/90321/ to
handle the case of offline migration (the aforementioned patch
handles only live migration). When images are not found in
glance, copy the missing images from the source host so migration
may proceed.

Closes-Bug: #1329313

Change-Id: I2c9fd63d0950fa9f3854c1c20cb7722d1c97b127

commit_message:
Simplify usage of ec2utils.get_db_item

At the moment we cann't completely get rid of validation of a kind of
an object ID, because common parameter validator doesn't validate
complex parameters. So this validation is still used in several cases.

Change-Id: Ibbe73a74306f2359f6554fcc8ef7bc31d356c167

commit_message:
Support i18n in magnum.

This patch adds support i18n in magnum and used
i18n log format for info level logs.

Change-Id: I4b4dc8bd1e167aff9b3daa27ae5bfbabe4e5fbc7
Partial-Bug: #1424499

Handle 404 in os-baremetal-nodes GET

to the caller.

commit_message:
Allow handling multiple service_types

If the same service_type was mentioned in the catalog more than once
then only the last entry would be parsed and any possible other matches
would be lost.

This was something that novaclient used to do, and as we are pushing
sessions as the way that clients should all work we need to maintain
that compatibility.

Change-Id: I6964515ed1975bce1998897abfc02a1ec36e2584
Closes-Bug: #1425766

commit_message:
Fix to enable floating ips with nova

It seems we have the options to start and enable nova floating ips
but we don't have any attributes to override to use them if wanted.
This patch defaults off with floating ips, but explains how to start it
if you want to.

Change-Id: I0998fe1b704460240171c4dd2dd7cc00b5fc0390
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-compute refs/changes/16/156416/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Options for floating ips for Nova # Turn this on to enable floating ips for nova default['openstack']['compute']['network']['floating'] = false# If you enable the above you need to set this to something that is the network you want default['openstack']['compute']['network']['floating']['ipv4_cidr'] = '10.10.10.0/24' # If you would like a range instead of a CIDR like above, comment out it and use the following default['openstack']['compute']['network']['floating']['ipv4_range'] = '10.10.10.1,10.10.10.5'

commit_message:
Allow Diskfile to choose whether to cleanup old files per policy

The EC design spec explains how, in order to protect from partial
PUT failures where less than a quorum was committed, the last
durable set of object fragments needs to be maintained until
the next set is confirmed to be present.

This is in cooperation with the reconstructor, this patch simply
adds the check in Diskfile to delete or not based on policy. Note
that this option doesn't apply to .ts files which will be cleaned
up as before regardless of policy.

Change-Id: I3befce8e823c16a8536729acdadcc32eef9b23e1
Implements: blueprint swift-ec

subject: EC: HTTP PUT/HEAD changes for object size/etag reporting
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-19 02:11:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/fa8931766c3a660d6a2072169c3a9304f0701c42', 'message': "WIP EC: HTTP PUT/HEAD changes for object size/etag reporting

Non-replication storage policies, such as 'erasure_coding' do not
store original object size and md5 hash in the Content-Length and
Etag metadata attributes that are typically stored with an object.
These policies use custom sysmeta attributes to store the size/md5
of the original object data.  For example, the 'erasure_coding'
policies use 'X-Object-Sysmeta-EC-Content-Length' and
'X-Object-Sysmeta-EC-Etag' metadata elements.

This patch also updates the tail of the PUT path to make sure we
update the container metadata with original object metadata
(Etag, Content-Length) and not the metadata for the on-disk
representation of the object

Changes -

 - Add support for mapping custom policy metadata fields to 'Etag'
   and 'Content-Length'
 - Add a response_metadata_items() method per policy to get the
   Etag/Content-Length mappings and also to get any custom metadata
   attributes object server wants to send back in a HEAD response
 - PUT changes to write correct object Etag/Content-Length values
   for original object data during container update
 - HEAD changes to make use of respose_metadata_items() to report
   original object attributes/customer metadata items in HEAD
   response

Change-Id: I769b263c675b71e4439ee87dda05d36ca900573a
Implements: blueprint ec-proxy-work

'X-Object-Sysmeta-EC-Etag' metadata elements.

This patch also updates the tail of the PUT path to make sure we
update the container metadata with original object metadata
(Etag, Content-Length) and not the metadata for the on-disk
representation of the object

Changes -

 - Add support for mapping custom policy metadata fields to 'Etag'
   and 'Content-Length'
 - Add a response_metadata_items() method per policy to get the
   Etag/Content-Length mappings and also to get any custom metadata
   attributes object server wants to send back in a HEAD response
 - PUT changes to write correct object Etag/Content-Length values

   original object attributes/customer metadata items in HEAD
   response

Change-Id: I769b263c675b71e4439ee87dda05d36ca900573a
Implements: blueprint ec-proxy-work
"}]
commit_message:
EC: HTTP PUT/HEAD changes for object size/etag reporting

Non-replication storage policies, such as 'erasure_coding' do not
store original object size and md5 hash in the Content-Length and
Etag metadata attributes that are typically stored with an object.
These policies use custom sysmeta attributes to store the size/md5
of the original object data.  For example, the 'erasure_coding'
policies use 'X-Object-Sysmeta-EC-Content-Length' and
'X-Object-Sysmeta-EC-Etag' metadata elements.

This patch also updates the tail of the PUT path to make sure we
update the container metadata with original object metadata
(Etag, Content-Length) and not the metadata for the on-disk
representation of the object

Changes -

 - Add support for mapping custom policy metadata fields to 'Etag'
   and 'Content-Length'
 - Add a response_metadata_items() method per policy to get the
   Etag/Content-Length mappings and also to get any custom metadata
   attributes object server wants to send back in a HEAD response
 - PUT changes to write correct object Etag/Content-Length values
   for original object data during container update
 - HEAD changes to make use of respose_metadata_items() to report
   original object attributes/customer metadata items in HEAD
   response

Change-Id: I769b263c675b71e4439ee87dda05d36ca900573a
Implements: blueprint ec-proxy-work
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/88/135488/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Create new config for pecan debug mode

Pecan's debug mode can be terribly insecure; 500 errors return a
Python traceback, the full list of environment variables, and a
button to replay the request with a breakpoint.

Deployers often run OpenStack services in debug mode; doing so should
not open the service up to these flaws. However, it may be useful
to use Pecan's debug mode in development, so create a config option
to enable it, rather than disable it altogether.

Change-Id: I5bc76b4101c563cdc168d2e55db060c1bdd0b5fe
Closes-Bug: #1425206

commit_message:
Use Unique SCST Group names in SCST cinder helper driver.

Currently, while setting up GROUPS under targets in scst.conf,
we are using the Initiator IQN as the group name. When we have
multiple targets and we want to connect LUN's from these multiple
targets to the same initiator, we are using the same GROUP name in
all the Target sections.

It would be good to provide a unique group name by prepending the
GROUP name with the target name. So the GROUP name will be
"Target name+Initiator IQN".

Change-Id: Ia0fbab18f792e602e1f4dae6f9ca0e607d0cfde3
Closes-Bug: #1424973
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/56/159156/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Cinder Pagination Sorting Enhancements

Commit Ia8781ed2d37fa2a0cb711a7f98d06919fc8a79d0 approved supporting multiple
sort keys and directions in the GET volumes REST APIs by using repeated
'sort_key' and 'sort_dir' query string parameters. This patch set updates the
existing spec to align with the API working group sorting guidelines by using
a single 'sort' query string parameter.

bp cinder-pagination
APIImpact

Change-Id: I95f7123d48ba4d9526617aba9ca60a9951d25faf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder-specs refs/changes/61/153061/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The /volumes and /volumes/detail APIs will align with the API working group guidelines (see References section) for sorting and support the following parameter on the request: * sort: Comma-separated list of sort keys, each key is optionally appended with <:dir>, where 'dir' is the direction for the corresponding sort key (supported values are 'asc' for ascending and 'desc' for descending) For example: ``/volumes?sort=status:asc,display_name:asc,created_at:desc``Multiple sort keys and directions could be passed using repeated 'sort_key' and 'sort_dir' query parameters. For example: ``/volumes?sort_key=status&sort_dir=asc&sort_key=display_name&sort_dir=asc& sort_key=created_at&sort_dir=desc`` However, this is not aligned with the API sorting guidelines.+-----------+-------+--------+------------------------------------------------+ | Parameter | Style | Type | Description | +===========+=======+========+================================================+ | sort | query | string | Comma-separated list of sort keys and optional | | | | | sort directions in the form of key<:dir>, | | | | | where 'dir' is either 'asc' for ascending | | | | | order or 'desc' for descending order. Defaults | | | | | to the 'created_at' and 'id' keys in | | | | | descending order. | +-----------+-------+--------+------------------------------------------------+ Currently, the volumes query supports the 'sort_key' and 'sort_dir' parameters; these will be deprecated. The API will raise a "badRequest" error response (code 400) if both the new 'sort' parameter and a deprecated 'sort_key' or 'sort_dir' parameter is specified.The cinderclient should be updated to accept sort keys and sort directions, using the 'sort' parameter being proposed in the cross-project spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/145544/* CLI Sorting Argument Guidelines cross project spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/145544/API Working group sorting guidelines: https://github.com/openstack/api-wg/blob/master/guidelines/ pagination_filter_sort.rst
deleted_lines: The /volumes and /volumes/detail APIs will support the following parameters being repeated on the request: * sort_key: Key used to determine sort order * sort_dir: Direction for with the associated sort key ("asc" or "desc") The caller can specify these parameters multiple times in order to generate a list of sort keys and sort directions. The first key listed is the primary key, the next key is the secondary key, etc. For example: /volumes?sort_key=status&sort_dir=desc&sort_key=display_name& &sort_dir=desc&sort_key=created_at&sort_dir=descRepeating parameter key/values was chosen because glance already did it: https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/api/v2/images.py#L526 And nova already approved this design in a similar blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/nova-pagination However, the list of sort keys and directions could be built by splitting the associated parameter values. For example: /volumes?sort_key=status,display_name,created_at&sort_dir=desc,desc,desc The downside of this approach is that it would require pre-defined token characters.+-----------+-------+--------+---------------------------------------------+ | Parameter | Style | Type | Description | +===========+=======+========+=============================================+ | sort_key | query | string | Sort key (repeated for multiple), keys | | | | | default to 'created_at' and 'id' | +-----------+-------+--------+---------------------------------------------+ | sort_dir | query | string | Sort direction, either 'asc' or 'desc' | | | | | (repeated for multiple), defaults to 'desc' | +-----------+-------+--------+---------------------------------------------+The cinderclient should be updated to accept sort keys and sort directions, new parameters: +-------------+----------------------------------------------------------+ | Parameter | Description | +=============+==========================================================+ | --sort-keys | Comma-separated list of sort keys used to specify volume | | | ordering. Each key must be paired with a sort direction | | | value. | +-------------+----------------------------------------------------------+ | --sort-dirs | Comma-separated list of sort directions used to specify | | | volume ordering. Each key Must be paired with a sort key | | | value. Valid values are 'asc' and 'desc'. | +-------------+----------------------------------------------------------+None

commit_message:
Add snapshot gigabytes quota

Manila has used single gigabytes quota for shares and snapshots.
Config opt 'no_snapshot_gb_quota' is set to False by default, that has been
used for enabling/disabling of snapshot gigabytes quota considerations.

Add separate snapshot gigabyte quota and remove opt 'no_snapshot_gb_quota' that
is not needed anymore. To be able to set infinite quota for snapshot gigabytes,
just set value for new config option 'quota_snapshot_gigabytes' to '-1'.

Change-Id: I43cb95ff3d0d3e6191f520b52edb67a0a44e9c2c
Implements BP add-snapshot-gb-quota

Added tests for the CSR validation functions

Separated out base function tests from _actual_ validation functions

Refactored validators.py to correct some arguments that shouldnt be
optional

commit_message:
Update repo with new testing suite

The new testing suite is based upon Chef 12, Chef DK and
Chef Provisioning.  It supports all in one and multi node
environments.  It will be used as the base for future gate
integration testing.  There's is more work to as noted in
the TODO list at the botton of the readme.

Note: to get this thru the existing gate, had to keep the existing
Gemfile.  Added a Gemfile-Provisioning for new stuff and updated
readme with some notes on that.  When we make the switch to kilo
rake gates, we can decide what type of gates the repo needs. I think
it's ready for rubocop at least and maybe continue with something
like spiecweasel to look at the role and environment syntax.

Added draft bootstrap and test default to rubocop to rakefile to
allow for easy integration with new gate rake jobs.

Change-Id: I187df8b78c4cecfb783ab26a6b66b8e8dd6745bd

commit_message:
Implement instance unrescue

Add driver method to implement the unrescue operation.
Renamed disconnect_image_volume to disconnect_volume since it
can disconnect any disk mapping.

Change-Id: I41054d610faa239d8cc08206a1a81106e5d6702e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm refs/changes/51/159551/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def disconnect_volume(self, context, instance, lpar_uuid, disk_type=None): LOG.info('Disconnecting volume from instance %s' % instance.name, instance=instance) # If disks were specified, only remove those. if disk_type: # Get the list of disk names disks = [self._get_disk_name(dt, instance) for dt in disk_type] # Build the lists of disk maps from the disk names disk_maps = [scsi_map for scsi_map in existing_maps if scsi_map.backing_storage.name in disks] else: # Otherwise, remove them all disk_maps = existing_maps # Remove each map for scsi_map in disk_maps: return disk_maps def _get_disk_name(self, disk_type, instance): return disk_type[:6] + '_' + instance.uuid[:8]
deleted_lines: def disconnect_image_volume(self, context, instance, lpar_uuid): LOG.info('Disconnecting ephemeral local volume from instance %s' % instance.name) for scsi_map in existing_maps: return existing_maps def _get_disk_name(self, type_, instance): return type_[:6] + '_' + instance.uuid[:8]

subject: Change test order to avoid incompatibliity
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-28 14:39:25.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/bashate/commit/fce82c76c8090c53ac9aaea7e518d714e237ace8', 'message': 'Change test order to avoid incompatibliity

If py26 or py27 tests are run first, there is a incompatibility in
the .testrepository that breaks several tests.  To get around this,
you need to run the py33 tests first.  This change was made over in
the cliff project.

Before:
    (.venv)terry@brat:~/bashate$ rm -rf .testrepository/
    (.venv)terry@brat:~/bashate$ tox
      ...
      py26: commands succeeded
      py27: commands succeeded
    ERROR:   py33: commands failed
    ERROR:   py34: commands failed
    ERROR:   pypy: commands failed
      pep8: commands succeeded
After:
    (.venv)terry@brat:~/bashate$ rm -rf .testrepository/
    (.venv)terry@brat:~/bashate$ tox
      ...
      py33: commands succeeded
      py34: commands succeeded
      py26: commands succeeded
      py27: commands succeeded
      pypy: commands succeeded
      pep8: commands succeeded
      congratulations :)
    (.venv)terry@brat:~/bashate$

Change-Id: I837eecd55e51c3ff10f8e9429f5eca94a2e58b38
'}]
commit_message:
Change test order to avoid incompatibliity

If py26 or py27 tests are run first, there is a incompatibility in
the .testrepository that breaks several tests.  To get around this,
you need to run the py33 tests first.  This change was made over in
the cliff project.

Before:
    (.venv)terry@brat:~/bashate$ rm -rf .testrepository/
    (.venv)terry@brat:~/bashate$ tox
      ...
      py26: commands succeeded
      py27: commands succeeded
    ERROR:   py33: commands failed
    ERROR:   py34: commands failed
    ERROR:   pypy: commands failed
      pep8: commands succeeded
After:
    (.venv)terry@brat:~/bashate$ rm -rf .testrepository/
    (.venv)terry@brat:~/bashate$ tox
      ...
      py33: commands succeeded
      py34: commands succeeded
      py26: commands succeeded
      py27: commands succeeded
      pypy: commands succeeded
      pep8: commands succeeded
      congratulations :)
    (.venv)terry@brat:~/bashate$

Change-Id: I837eecd55e51c3ff10f8e9429f5eca94a2e58b38
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bashate refs/changes/96/150796/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: envlist = py33,py34,py26,py27,pypy,pep8
deleted_lines: envlist = py26,py27,py33,py34,pypy,pep8

subject: Add Nova-network support to service_instance module
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-14 18:39:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/c6c1cedb93372a6bd4237dda9db75989b679971f', 'message': "[WIP] Add Nova-network support to service_instance module

Till that moment it was possible to use Generic driver only with Neutron.
Nova network still is used in various deployments, so add support for it.

List of changes:
- Split service_instance to two parts - compute and networking.
- Implement networking part as 'network helpers'.
- Add new config option 'service_instance_network_helper_type' that supports
only two values - 'nova' and 'neutron' respectively.
It is required option. Default value is 'neutron'.

Details on Nova-network approach:
- Due to resctrictions of Nova network, where security group rules are applied
to all VM network interfaces, no need to create service network, because it
will be just duplication. Service instance will use only one network that is
provided within share-network entity.
- Host of manila-share service should have network connectivity for all
networks, that are going to be used for share creations.
- Nova network helper does not create resources, so, network is not configured
by Manila in that case. So, network infrastructure can be either flat or using
VLAN segmentation as well.

TODO: Fix and add unit tests

Change-Id: I7462fe3d6fa944d391628b8e2b374cf5593924ea
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-14 18:52:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/7b7e265bd4befe1356f366171f65f5199db503a8', 'message': "[WIP] Add Nova-network support to service_instance module

- Add new config option 'service_instance_network_helper_type' that supports
only two values - 'nova' and 'neutron' respectively.
It is required option. Default value is 'neutron'.

Details on Nova-network approach:
- Due to resctrictions of Nova network, where security group rules are applied
to all VM network interfaces, no need to create service network, because it
will be just duplication. Service instance will use only one network that is
provided within share-network entity.
- Host of manila-share service should have network connectivity for all
networks, that are going to be used for share creations.
- Nova network helper does not create resources, so, network is not configured
by Manila in that case. So, network infrastructure can be either flat or using
VLAN segmentation as well.

TODO: Fix and add unit tests

Implements BP nova-network-support-in-generic-driver
Implements BP split-service-instance
Change-Id: I7462fe3d6fa944d391628b8e2b374cf5593924ea

commit_message:
Add Nova-network support to service_instance module

Till that moment it was possible to use Generic driver only with Neutron.
Nova network still is used in various deployments, so add support for it.

List of changes:
- Split service_instance to two parts - compute and networking.
- Implement networking part as 'network helpers'.
- Add new config option 'service_instance_network_helper_type' that supports
only two values - 'nova' and 'neutron' respectively.
It is required option. Default value is 'neutron'.

Details on Nova-network approach:
- Due to resctrictions of Nova network, where security group rules are applied
to all VM network interfaces, no need to create service network, because it
will be just duplication. Service instance will use only one network that is
provided within share-network entity.
- Host of manila-share service should have network connectivity for all
networks, that are going to be used for share creations.
- Nova network helper does not create resources, so, network is not configured
by Manila in that case. So, network infrastructure can be either flat or using
VLAN segmentation as well.

Implements BP nova-network-support-in-generic-driver
Implements BP split-service-instance
Change-Id: I7462fe3d6fa944d391628b8e2b374cf5593924ea

commit_message:
Use HTTP BASIC AUTH exclusively (no longer use JSESSIONID)

It also fixes an issue about the former auth implementation when ODL
restarts. It implies the use of OpenDaylight Helium SR2.

Closes-Bug: 1376169
Closes-Bug: 1419499

Conflicts:
	networking_odl/common/client.py

Change-Id: I97c610578fe489b25697394fa33f5410f0bfbe1b
Signed-off-by: Ed Warnicke <eaw@cisco.com>
(cherry picked from commit f25f85eaeca1deeada6c7fd70abf83b31046c89e)

Don't run gate-trove-functional-dsvm-mysql for Icehouse

db_load_datastore_config_parameters parameter [1].

commit_message:
Reduce length of tenant ID

Keystone only stores tenant as ia 64-character strings, so there is no
reason for Heat to store it as a 256 character string. Also 256
character UTF-8 strings cannot be indexed by MySQL, and will also be
stored as a TINYTEXT column, resulting in slower performance.

Note that we do not need to alter the software_deployment and
software_config back to 256, because they have been reduced to that
length by I27b9c61828301ba8c392b3d316f656641af753bc.

Change-Id: Ib4a99a0e84c7bd17fdaf4874e1b36d75f14c4c6a
Related-Bug: #1316646

commit_message:
Fix co-dependent tempest issues

We noticed at the gate for icehouse alone that tempest tests were not
being collected or run. This was due to the fact that the version of
tempest we checkout has vendorized oslo.log code from oslo-incubator
which has a dependency on oslo.serialization.

We don't deploy swift in icehouse so tempest tests are not going to
work.

Co-Authored-By: Hugh Saunders<hugh@wherenow.org>

Change-Id: I416c4db4c6689cdcd701747e5cb1d566eae72140
Closes-bug: 1425767

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-08 21:30:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-glanceclient/commit/7fdfbcfd133054da647aadedd7d646b556acd49c', 'message': "Switch fallback import ordering for Debian/Fedora

As described in the bug report, modifications to module-level globals
has issues when there are two entries in sys.modules for an imported
module. To avoid this, let's show preference to the systems and users
that use distribution provided packages and prevent them from running
into this issue. This will have no effect on those installing the client
from PyPI using pip.

Change-Id: Ic77ce8a06d9d148a899b4b8695990fca8fdaefc5
Closes-bug: 1396550
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-09 20:03:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-glanceclient/commit/f3f47a4512b70c8bfb4fc888426b20f13d5ee363', 'message': 'Register our own ConnectionPool without globals

Currently, on systems like Fedora and Debian, it is possible to import urllib3
as well as requests.packages.urllib3. They functionally point to the same code
but sys.modules considers them to be separate items. When downstream packagers
unvendor urllib3 from requests, they also change all the imports inside of the
package. So if the code imports urllib3 from requests.packages.urllib3 and
modifies globals in a submodule, that will not be visible to requests since it
has been rewritten to use urllib3 (not requests.packages.urllib3). By handling
this logic ourselves, we can issue a release until upstream packages and
requests can fix this and cut a new release.

commit_message:
Register our own ConnectionPool without globals

Currently, on systems like Fedora and Debian, it is possible to import
urllib3 as well as requests.packages.urllib3. They functionally point to
the same code but sys.modules considers them to be separate items. When
downstream packagers unvendor urllib3 from requests, they also change
all the imports inside of the package. So if the code imports urllib3
from requests.packages.urllib3 and modifies globals in a submodule, that
will not be visible to requests since it has been rewritten to use
urllib3 (not requests.packages.urllib3). By handling this logic
ourselves, we can issue a release until upstream packages and requests
can fix this and cut a new release.

Change-Id: Ic77ce8a06d9d148a899b4b8695990fca8fdaefc5
Closes-bug: 1396550

deleted_lines: from requests.packages.urllib3 import poolmanager

commit_message:
Don't try to add an IP if there is one

On Rackspace there is an automatic IP. The code before inappropriately
attempted to add a floating IP anyway.

Change-Id: I63fd7ec0abc06a24b1869aa35cb1084cb228e4ca

commit_message:
New element that uses existing images for OS

There are many use cases where a base image can be customized further.
The element here copies the contents of one image into the new image.

Change-Id: I779696a5497123acf5a86048a8073afca18dc16c

commit_message:
Move install type support to source-repositories

This functionality is documented in source-repositories, not base. So a
user building an image without source-repositories would not expect this
behavior, and also a user building without base, but with
source-repositories, will expect it but not get it.

Change-Id: If9e6eac751c2fdb2bd203eb5d4e25d303f767c10

commit_message:
Create element to preserve passwd and group

Provides a guard against accidental UID swapping.

Change-Id: I18099a44555391a728f8d0fd2939f5cc2a507a2b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/27/126427/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: UID and GID mappings may be lost when storing state that is meant to survive replacing the root disk. New images may in fact have a different /etc/passwd or /etc/group mapping and then files on the state partition will have th ewrong UID/GID. In order to provide consistent UID/GID's we will preserve the user and group databases into the state partition, and then fail o-r-c when we detect a skew with the system database of UIDs/GIDs.

commit_message:
nova flavor-access-add does not validate tenantid

nova flavor-access-add command does not validates
if the tenant-id provided by the user is a valid id
or not. It accepts any random string.

After, the changes nova flavor-access-add throws
a command error stating that the tenant does not
exist and you need to provide a vaild tenant-id.
Closes-Bug: #1391737

Change-Id: I0229f818f8043d2242b5158c187dee428e63bc8b

commit_message:
Ensure arping always exits

It is possible for the arping process to hang if the interface is
removed while it is running. This patch adds a timeout to ensure
that the process eventually exits no matter what.

Change-Id: I60458b91e88b3fbd9fbc19c004e47a005b0ed408
Closes-Bug: #1425173
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/80/158780/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: arping_cmd = ['arping', '-A', '-I', iface_name, '-c', count, '-w', 1.5 * count, address]
deleted_lines: arping_cmd = ['arping', '-A', '-I', iface_name, '-c', count, address]

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-20 07:18:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient/commit/cfe1d863f77d137ff410fefb0548597dbae26a1b', 'message': "Return Error when resize failed

novaclient can have following output
nova resize --poll t9 12
Server resizing... 100% complete
Finished

but in compute layer it's
ResizeError: Resize error: Unable to resize disk down.

the instance state is not changed from ACTIVE to VERFIY_RESIZE

Change-Id: Ife26f6af144b8c1e42769f76e1d0d850eb54efa2
Closes-Bug: #1323996
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-06-23 09:26:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient/commit/66eea9ce970f9ddf21e42eb9f789532b3eb67df2', 'message': "Return Error when resize failed

novaclient can have following output
nova resize --poll t9 12
Server resizing... 100% complete
Finished

but in compute layer it's
ResizeError: Resize error: Unable to resize disk down.

the instance state is not changed from ACTIVE to VERFIY_RESIZE

Change-Id: Ife26f6af144b8c1e42769f76e1d0d850eb54efa2
Closes-Bug: #1323996
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-07-15 08:21:04.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/tests/v1_1/test_shell.py', 'novaclient/tests/v3/test_shell.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/shell.py', 'novaclient/v3/shell.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient/commit/22eacfbd12c920bc6996f702c6a5e6bebbcd8172', 'message': "Return Error when resize failed

novaclient can have following output
nova resize --poll t9 12
Server resizing... 100% complete
Finished

but in compute layer it's
ResizeError: Resize error: Unable to resize disk down.

At nova side, it will change the state from ACTIVE to VERFIY_RESIZE
if the resize operation success, if anything fails during the
resize operation, the vm state will be set back to ACTIVE which means
the resize operations failed. And the VERFIY_RESIZE is the only
state that indicates the resize operation success.

It's not easy to fix in nova side because nova API layer will
cast message to compute layer and API layer can't know whether the
instance is successfully resized. This patch follows the existing
nova client mechanism, moves the ACTIVE state out of successful
list because actually it means resize failed.

Change-Id: Ife26f6af144b8c1e42769f76e1d0d850eb54efa2
Closes-Bug: #1323996
"}]
commit_message:
Return Error when resize failed

novaclient can have following output
nova resize --poll t9 12
Server resizing... 100% complete
Finished

but in compute layer it's
ResizeError: Resize error: Unable to resize disk down.

At nova side, it will change the state from ACTIVE to VERFIY_RESIZE
if the resize operation success, if anything fails during the
resize operation, the vm state will be set back to ACTIVE which means
the resize operations failed. And the VERFIY_RESIZE is the only
state that indicates the resize operation success.

It's not easy to fix in nova side because nova API layer will
cast message to compute layer and API layer can't know whether the
instance is successfully resized. This patch follows the existing
nova client mechanism, moves the ACTIVE state out of successful
list because actually it means resize failed.

Change-Id: Ife26f6af144b8c1e42769f76e1d0d850eb54efa2
Closes-Bug: #1323996
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/35/101435/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _poll_for_status(poll_fn, obj_id, action, final_stop_states, status_field="status", silent=False, final_success_states=None): if final_success_states is None: final_success_states = final_stop_states if status in final_stop_states: elif status == "error" or status in final_stop_states: ['active', 'verify_resize'], final_success_states=['verify_resize'])
deleted_lines: def _poll_for_status(poll_fn, obj_id, action, final_ok_states, status_field="status", silent=False): if status in final_ok_states: elif status == "error": ['active', 'verify_resize'])

commit_message:
Fix KeyErrors from incorrectly formatted NovaExceptions in unit tests

When testr runs it dumps out stacktraces for KeyError when formatting
NovaException messages with missing kwargs. This fixes the incorrect
testing exceptions.

To verify the changes, set fatal_exception_format_errors=True.

Closes-Bug: #1425343

Change-Id: I31de1f98e842cf9cad3a6b93313eb43b658b23d5

commit_message:
Adding user parameter to keypair-list

Closes-Bug: #1182965

Administering an openstack cluster I found the need to see what
keypairs a user had. I found this bug that was requesting the
same thing. This is the update to the novaclient to collect the
value and fold it into the api call. Only a user with admin
privilages is allowed to make this call.

Change-Id: I54b4f31b4a74843b340e956d15ffaeb640cedc02
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/90/70490/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @utils.arg('--user', metavar='<user-id>', default=None, help='ID of user to list the keypairs for. (Admin only)') if args.user: keypairs = cs.keypairs.list(args.user) else: keypairs = cs.keypairs.list()
deleted_lines: keypairs = cs.keypairs.list()

commit_message:
Add CHAP persistence to SCST target helper

The SCST target helper currently does not have a mechanism to
persist CHAP records. Added this support so that LUNs will
get re-exported if Cinder service restarts.

Change-Id: I3daa48e7f460feef9764b79b47d7be308579fe40
Closes-Bug: #1421570

commit_message:
Passes the plugin context variable in the ML2 Extension Driver API

Many neutron extensions(like portsecurity) use the plugin_context
variable instead of just the database session. This change
modifies the extension driver api to pass the plugin_context

Change request also modifies the extend_XXX resource api to use the
respective data model(network/subnet/port) passed to it.

Implements: blueprint extensions-in-ml2
Partially Implements: blueprint ml2-ovs-portsecurity
Closes-Bug: 1382448
Change-Id: Icf84615e5fee8b59cbc95ab9b634f1a49f4b56a3

commit_message:
Add oslo.serialization to the dependencies for tempest

We noticed at the gate for icehouse alone that tempest tests were not
being collected or run. This was due to the fact that the version of
tempest we checkout has vendorized oslo.log code from oslo-incubator
which has a dependency on oslo.serialization.

Conflicts:
	playbooks/roles/os_neutron/tasks/main.yml

Change-Id: I416c4db4c6689cdcd701747e5cb1d566eae72140
Closes-bug: 1425767
(cherry picked from commit 4f0f124aef0a05a1e83366c25f3bb79a81f430cd)

commit_message:
Create/Delete FIP Agent gateway port only if DVR Routers

A recent patch for creating FloatingIP Agent gateway
port without RPC dependency was trying to create
FloatingIP Agent Gateway port for both Legacy and
DVR routers.
"Change-id: Ieaa79c8bf2b1e03bc352f9252ce22286703e3715"

This patch fixes the problem by checking for the router,
before it tries to create or delete a FloatingIP Agent
Gateway Port.

Change-Id: I588b518d2fffd3943abe6d70fb0308adbe46e974
Closes-Bug: #1423422

commit_message:
Create validate step for Neutron third-party programs

Add a new function to lib/neutron that can be implemented by scripts under
lib/neutron_thirdparty to validate that the current configuration
is compatible with the third-party program. This can be used, for example, to
ensure that enabled services do not conflict with the third-party program
and that pre-requisite services are enabled. Adding a validate step
relatively early in the stacking process allows it to fail fast when
incompatible configuration is detected.

Call this function in a new section of stack.sh, 'Validate Configuration',
directly after the 'Configure Projects' section.

Also, fix a typo in lib/neutron_thirdparty/bigswitch_floodlight

Change-Id: Icf58b6bec0f1f31320b4e126d6e27a047e31da74
Closes-Bug: #1386267
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/93/133993/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Validate Configuration # ====================== # Ensure we fail relatively early in the stacking process # if the current configuration is incompatible with enabled services # Neutron if is_service_enabled neutron; then validate_neutron_third_party fi

commit_message:
Add wget to package-installs.yaml for epel

A recent commit (I29c73355a85112840b57f93b39a9eeda421875e6) updated the
epel element to rely on wget, but wget is not always installed. Since
wget is used in pre-install.d, we must install it in that phase.

Change-Id: Iad2a9c4f0081835a1aa78e6fd2f721f6afd44dc2

commit_message:
Do not allow the use of slash in the project name

To get a scoped token using the project name, we will need
to inform the full hierarchy path. For that, we will use the '/'
character as a delimiter between the projects, so for this point,
we will not allow the use of slash in the project name.

This patch is part from the Reseller spec.

Co-Authored-By: Rodrigo Duarte Sousa <rodrigods@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Partially-Implements: bp reseller

Change-Id: Ic86f8f9da69b8d97e78271a4d7373c83ea28689e

commit_message:
Allow user to set a prop back to default

This allows the attribute/prop to be set while still bypassing the type
conversion introduced in I106c9c54f57596cb2e12e8bbb5cd380867be876b.

Closes-bug: 1425996
Change-Id: I388b671b1574109c767724a0be17ce60034036be
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/67/159567/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: not_default = 'not default' t2 = Test({'attr2': not_default}) self.assertEqual(t2.attr2, not_default) # Assert that if the default is passed in, it overrides the previously # set value (bug #1425996) t2.attr2 = new_default self.assertEqual(t2.attr2, new_default)

commit_message:
Fix odd formats in api-microversions spec

"::" of previous "For example" exists already, and the next "::" makes
meaningless "::" in a html document. In addition, there are many ">"s
before sample code even if these code appears as literal blocks.
This patch removes them for the readability.

Change-Id: I0a4042247e0481b4ef7c374792a5b9e9c4d2eb09
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/99/158999/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Respect NODEPOOL_SSH_KEY in prepare-node for dib

We dont respect this parameter when building dib images.

Change-Id: I403b59f150d11bfa01875a89de777023c15d2e71
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/05/157205/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ -n "$NODEPOOL_SSH_KEY" ] ; then puppet_install_users="install_users => false, ssh_key => '$NODEPOOL_SSH_KEY'," else puppet_install_users="" fi $puppet_install_users

subject: Change order of grub2 check
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-18 22:12:39.000000000', 'files': ['elements/vm/finalise.d/51-bootloader'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/6fc00cc94ee6c9a526e239d91a59f5aa5cfd9224', 'message': 'Change order of grub2 check

The vm element needs to check if this is a grub 1.99 system
BEFORE it attempts to do an offline installation of grub2. In the
current state, this errors out with `No package grub2 available.`

Change-Id: I6dfd0868e51ae70ac580442923c30341caa9ae16
'}]
commit_message:
Change order of grub2 check

The vm element needs to check if this is a grub 1.99 system
BEFORE it attempts to do an offline installation of grub2. In the
current state, this errors out with `No package grub2 available.`

Change-Id: I6dfd0868e51ae70ac580442923c30341caa9ae16
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/70/157170/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Check for offline installation of grub if [ -f "/tmp/grub/install" ] ; then source /tmp/grub/install elif [[ "$ARCH" =~ "ppc" ]]; then install-packages grub-ieee1275 else install-packages grub-pc fi
deleted_lines: # Check for offline installation of grub if [ -f "/tmp/grub/install" ] ; then source /tmp/grub/install elif [[ "$ARCH" =~ "ppc" ]]; then install-packages grub-ieee1275 else install-packages grub-pc fi

Move to oslo.db

All openstack projects are moving to oslo.db since it has
graduated from oslo-incubator.

commit_message:
Sync python-cueclient to vagrant home intead of /opt/stack

* Syncing to /opt/stack means chown fails during stack.sh

Change-Id: Iff2d890716803aa8718b1a9bb8cbd8871464c110

commit_message:
Remove lib-forward-testing from openstackclient

The requirements to have openstackclient features cannot match the
requirements limits set to older version of OpenStack, so let's remove
these jobs.

Change-Id: I3441932358212b765988e10be7db9ce41d381556
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/24/156224/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove discover from test requirements

The package is used to provide new unittest module features for python
installations older than 2.7. Since we don't support py26 target
anymore, the dependency is safe to kill.

Change-Id: Icb238d577d0dd30e091bdb65dcec5f695749dc7b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/39/159139/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add 2to3 compatibility for functools.wraps

In order to support compatibility between functools.wraps
in version 2 and 3 (3.4 or later) functools.wraps was replaced
by six.wraps. The behaviour of sixdecorator is exaclty the same
but it also supports __wrapped__ attribute according to
3.4 specs.

Change-Id: Ib695629e69e517206e630fff026c08b7847402dc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/56/159456/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @six.wraps(handler) @six.wraps(handler)
deleted_lines: import functools @functools.wraps(handler) @functools.wraps(handler)

commit_message:
Refactor tests for migrations in heat

test_walk_version test in HeatMigrationCheckers has checked that
the version of oslo.db should be more than 0.4. We have
oslo.db >= 1.4.0 in our project requirements. So this redundant
check in the test has been removed.

Change-Id: I3147e2f76a2564daa4dffc902875617ca3dc7968
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/39/159439/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.walk_versions(self.snake_walk, self.downgrade)
deleted_lines: import pkg_resources as pkg # TODO(viktors): Refactor this method, when we will be totally sure, # that Heat use oslo.db>=0.4.0 try: pkg.require('oslo.db>=0.4.0') self._walk_versions(self.snake_walk, self.downgrade) except pkg.VersionConflict: self._walk_versions(self.engine, self.snake_walk, self.downgrade)

commit_message:
Use mock instead of mox in clients test

Using mock instead of mox objects in tests for cinder, glance, nova.
Also scenario test was added for testing nova function "refresh_server".

Change-Id: Ic812efc1e8ef2fb3ef79d2dc6a9acc38798dbe87

commit_message:
Update documentation on VirtualBox drivers

This has minor cleanup of the documentation on VirtualBox
drivers. It fixes some grammatical issues and adds a bit more
clarification to some of the instructions for setting up a
developer's environment.

This is a follow up to I2018f9a89a3644863569ddac3126db71b125fb59.

Change-Id: I0f84554c98317160bfdfee14ba923cff4adda773
Implements: blueprint ironic-virtualbox-webservice-support

commit_message:
Prepare for Services in virtual env

* Build a wheel cache for the target environment
* Change the target ervice etups to use the new virtual-env
  interface stack_service_install(): keystone, glance, cinder, nova,
  swift, ironic, ceilometer

Change-Id: I1c0bf73d30ec138f2a8321b656c664770be571a7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/grenade refs/changes/76/158376/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Build a wheel cache source $TARGET_DEVSTACK_DIR/stackrc if [[ -n ${WHEELHOUSE:-} && ! -d ${WHEELHOUSE:-} ]]; then source $TARGET_DEVSTACK_DIR/tools/build_wheels.sh fi

subject: Use neutron's api job to validate func job change
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-25 19:27:03.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/neutron-api.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/b18645b80e8c2fa1d7b211685fe037942c6e4f51', 'message': "Use neutron's api job to validate func job change

A recent commit to devstack-gate added support for limiting the repos
that are updated for a node by overriding the PROJECTS variable.  This
change temporarily repurposes neutron's api job to check that setting
this override is compatible with the functional job.  The api job is
currently non-voting, so no patches will be harmed in the process.

Change-Id: I7591569d3f039eeebed859333b29dd63104cd389
"}]
commit_message:
Use neutron's api job to validate func job change

A recent commit to devstack-gate added support for limiting the repos
that are updated for a node by overriding the PROJECTS variable.  This
change temporarily repurposes neutron's api job to check that setting
this override is compatible with the functional job.  The api job is
currently non-voting, so no patches will be harmed in the process.

Change-Id: I7591569d3f039eeebed859333b29dd63104cd389
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/32/159232/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export DEVSTACK_GATE_PROJECTS_OVERRIDE="openstack-dev/devstack openstack/neutron" bash -xe $BASE/new/neutron/neutron/tests/contrib/gate_hook.sh dsvm-functional bash -xe $BASE/new/neutron/neutron/tests/contrib/post_test_hook.sh dsvm-functional
deleted_lines: bash -xe $BASE/new/neutron/neutron/tests/contrib/gate_hook.sh api bash -xe $BASE/new/neutron/neutron/tests/contrib/post_test_hook.sh api

commit_message:
Improve last_error for async exceptions

This sets the last_error to have a more informative message when errors
occur in agent vendor asyncronous tasks.

Change-Id: I1a0962224c84725329ee834a67dbe9da8c417fb1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/38/158938/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except Exception as e: last_error = 'Async exception: %(msg)s; exception: %(e)s' % { 'msg': msg, 'e': e, } LOG.exception(_LE('Async exception for %(node)s: %(msg)s; %(e)s'), 'msg': msg, 'e': e}) deploy_utils.set_failed_state(task, last_error)
deleted_lines: except Exception: LOG.exception(_LE('Async exception for %(node)s: %(msg)s'), 'msg': msg}) deploy_utils.set_failed_state(task, msg)

commit_message:
Add ceilometer to rootwrap check

Ceilometer also makes use of rootwrap (only for ipmitool), so
let's make sure its also flagged.

Change-Id: Ibbac902f653b3918e78fe27ec89783feff6b5f7d

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-25 22:29:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/05e0b984bbfc5f45b8686017692c9684846013bb', 'message': 'Add flat network gateway to br-vlan for AIO builds

When an AIO is built using the included scripts and networking config, the public network has a gateway IP of 172.29.248.1 from the 172.29.248.0/22 network, which is not expected or configured to exist anywhere. This can cause issues when using floats or in general if some communication is desired which uses the public side gateway of the neutron-routed network.

A simple solution is to simply drop 172.29.248.1/22 on br-vlan via the interface config, which allows the traffic to do the needful, at least as far as tempest's requirements are concerned. In modern Debian/Ubuntu, this can be accomplished with another "iface" stanza with its own "address" directive to add the additional address.

Change-Id: I79897bc4e4d7eb7d55ad3c12f55a339dfef869e1
Closes-Bug: #1425717
Related-Bug: #1425255

commit_message:
Add flat network gateway to br-vlan for AIO builds

When an AIO is built using the included scripts and networking config,
the public network has a gateway IP of 172.29.248.1 from the
172.29.248.0/22 network, which is not expected or configured to exist
anywhere. This can cause issues when using floats or in general if
some communication is desired which uses the public side gateway of
the neutron-routed network.

A simple solution is to simply drop 172.29.248.1/22 on br-vlan via the
interface config, which allows the traffic to do the needful, at least
as far as tempest's requirements are concerned. In modern
Debian/Ubuntu, this can be accomplished with another "iface" stanza
with its own "address" directive to add the additional address.

Change-Id: I79897bc4e4d7eb7d55ad3c12f55a339dfef869e1
Closes-Bug: #1425717
Related-Bug: #1425255
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/76/159276/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iface br-vlan inet static address 172.29.248.1 netmask 255.255.252.0

commit_message:
Only use public_endpoint when specified

Default public_endpoint in keystone.conf to not be set, unless
specified. By default this value isn't required.

Change-Id: I5f5c213ef639f548b80080c5c5338db610b0b7f8
Closes-Bug: #1421048
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/80/159180/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% if keystone_public_endpoint is defined %} public_endpoint = {{ keystone_public_endpoint }} {% endif %}

commit_message:
Add iRMC Management module for iRMC Driver

This module inherits ipmitool.IPMIManagement and overrides the
following two functions for iRMC Drivers in order to make use of iRMC
IPMI boot mode get/set capability and SCCI get sensor data.

* set_boot_device()
* get_sensors_data()

Implements: blueprint irmc-management-driver
Change-Id: I8dd6e76a7e85eb477dcde11e322fa1e308fe968c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/03/146803/19 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ iRMC Driver using ServerView Common Command Interface (SCCI) """ from ironic.drivers import base from ironic.drivers.modules import ipmitool from ironic.drivers.modules.irmc import management from ironic.drivers.modules.irmc import power from ironic.drivers.modules import pxe class PXEiRMCDriver(base.BaseDriver): """iRMC driver using PXE for deploy.""" def __init__(self): self.power = power.IRMCPower() self.console = ipmitool.IPMIShellinaboxConsole() self.deploy = pxe.PXEDeploy() self.management = management.IRMCManagement() self.vendor = pxe.VendorPassthru()

subject: List all CIRROS ARCH images in image_list.sh
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-25 19:40:56.000000000', 'files': ['tools/image_list.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/71e82f52bde99b4bf791ea1558f1abf86019a384', 'message': "List all CIRROS ARCH images in image_list.sh

image_list.sh is used to make a list of all possible images. Loop over
both x86_64 and i386 instead of just using the default arch of x86_64

For live migration we are starting to use the i386 arch based images and
don't want to cache them like all other images.

Change-Id: I47da72a0e9da3689cb085bb43ac6536094445112
"}]
commit_message:
List all CIRROS ARCH images in image_list.sh

image_list.sh is used to make a list of all possible images. Loop over
both x86_64 and i386 instead of just using the default arch of x86_64

For live migration we are starting to use the i386 arch based images and
don't want to cache them like all other images.

Change-Id: I47da72a0e9da3689cb085bb43ac6536094445112

commit_message:
Implement Cleaning States

Adds cleaning states to the state machine and implements _do_node_clean
in the conductor. Changes DELETING->AVAILABLE and MANAGEABLE->AVAILABLE
transitions to always go through the cleaning process. Cleaning can
be disabled with a config option added in a later patch to maintain
the same functionality as in Juno had with ACTIVE->DELETING->NOSTATE.

Implements blueprint implement-cleaning-states
Change-Id: Ie968e5b3d45f417e98da6b3d985de5bfd851c364
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/44/153444/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: | 1.24 - Added do_node_clean def do_node_clean(self, context, node_id, topic=None): """Signal to conductor service to perform automated cleaning of a node. :param context: request context. :param node_id: node id or uuid. :param topic: RPC topic. Defaults to self.topic. :raises: InstanceCleanFailure :raises: InvalidParameterValue if validation fails :raises: MissingParameterValue if a required parameter is missing :raises: NoFreeConductorWorker when there is no free worker to start async task. The node must already be configured and in the appropriate deployed state before this method is called. """ cctxt = self.client.prepare(topic=topic or self.topic, version='1.24') return cctxt.call(context, 'do_node_clean', node_id=node_id)

commit_message:
Remove unused OS_TEST_TIMEOUT variable

When running the unit tests, this environment variable was being
set: OS_TEST_TIMEOUT=60. However, this variable isn't used, and
there doesn't seem to be a need to use it, so it is removed here.

Change-Id: Iede6fda9f8844ec1769ec988eade9229f55521c6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient refs/changes/08/155408/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: test_command=OS_STDOUT_CAPTURE=${OS_STDOUT_CAPTURE:-1} OS_STDERR_CAPTURE=${OS_STDERR_CAPTURE:-1} OS_TEST_TIMEOUT=60 ${PYTHON:-python} -m subunit.run discover -t ./ ./ $LISTOPT $IDOPTION

subject: Set instance NUMA topology on HostState
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-18 09:55:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/eab4ae69ab80b1536bf0702e6242323b8328188d', 'message': 'Set instance NUMA topology on HostState

NUMATopologyFilter will try to fit an instance onto every host
(represented by a HostState instance) so assigning the resulting
instance topology to the instance dict really makes no sense, as we end
up with only the last calculated topology from all the filter runs.

This in turn makes consume_from_instance not work as expected, as it
will consume NUMA topology calculated from the last host the filter was
run on, not the host that was chosen by the scheduler.

This patch stashes the calculated NUMA topology onto the HostState
instance passed to the filter, that will be used in
consume_from_instance, and makes sure that is what gets used for
updating the usage.

Change-Id: Ifacccadf73dc114e50f46b8e6087ffb2b2fc9d6b
Closes-Bug: #1405359

commit_message:
Set instance NUMA topology on HostState

NUMATopologyFilter will try to fit an instance onto every host
(represented by a HostState instance) so assigning the resulting
instance topology to the instance dict really makes no sense, as we end
up with only the last calculated topology from all the filter runs.

This in turn makes consume_from_instance not work as expected, as it
will consume NUMA topology calculated from the last host the filter was
run on, not the host that was chosen by the scheduler.

This patch stashes the calculated NUMA topology onto the HostState
instance passed to the filter, that will be used in
consume_from_instance, and makes sure that is what gets used for
updating the usage.

Change-Id: Ifacccadf73dc114e50f46b8e6087ffb2b2fc9d6b
Closes-Bug: #1405359
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/30/156930/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.instance_numa_topology = None instance['numa_topology'] = self.instance_numa_topology

commit_message:
VPNaaS refactor service driver to reuse VpnDriver code

Introduce BaseIPsecVpnDriver class to host most of the
common code to be shared across various implementations
of VPN service-drivers. This reduces the duplicate code
in these service-drivers

Closes-Bug: #1422905
Related-Bug: #1423244
Co-Authored-By: Numan Siddique <numan.siddique@enovance.com>
Change-Id: Ibde249af5c7228e2f9b7496cb03bd9b516966ef5

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-23 23:21:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas/commit/6355193c4c08739e06ae0312bebb03bee428e55b', 'message': "Change L3 agent AdvancedService class to be non-singleton

The idea behind the AdvancedServices (Metadata, *aaS) drivers

(1) Since the AdvancedService.instance method required an instance

commit_message:
Change L3 agent AdvancedService class to be non-singleton

The idea behind the AdvancedServices (Metadata, *aaS) services
to be singletons was to (1) offer a way to get an instance of such
a service in a convinient manner, and to (2) ensure that only one
service registered per service type.

(1) Since the AdvancedService.instance method required an instance
of a L3 agent, this point was kind of missed. If you have a L3 agent
instance in your hand, just use it to access the service you're looking
for.

(2) This is now fulfilled by asserting that only one driver is registered
(per type) in the .add method.

The motivation to make them non-singletons is that:
a) They don't need to be
b) The code is simplified this way
c) I've been facing crazy issues during functional testing where we're
   constantly instantiating L3 agents, and the (singleton) metadata
   service was referencing the wrong configuration object. The service
   was re-initialized during a test, screwing up the configuration of
   other mid-run tests.

Related-Bug: #1425759
Change-Id: I155aece9b7028f1bdd3d9709facef392b38aec27
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas refs/changes/86/158486/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add localboot support for iscsi_ilo driver

This adds localboot support for iscsi_ilo driver
by enabling it to recognise boot_option in
it's vendor passthru and set boot device to disk.

Implements: blueprint local-boot-support-with-partition-images
Change-Id: I55ddacb010376d3045ea6fa68d82ef5aa5a57db4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/08/156608/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch.object(deploy_utils, 'notify_deploy_complete') @mock.patch.object(manager_utils, 'node_set_boot_device') @mock.patch.object(iscsi_deploy, 'continue_deploy') @mock.patch.object(ilo_common, 'cleanup_vmedia_boot') def test__continue_deploy_localboot(self, cleanup_vmedia_boot_mock, continue_deploy_mock, set_boot_device_mock, notify_deploy_complete_mock): kwargs = {'method': 'pass_deploy_info', 'address': '123456'} continue_deploy_mock.return_value = '<some-uuid>' self.node.provision_state = states.DEPLOYWAIT self.node.target_provision_state = states.ACTIVE i_info = self.node.instance_info i_info['capabilities'] = '{"boot_option": "local"}' self.node.instance_info = i_info self.node.save() with task_manager.acquire(self.context, self.node.uuid, shared=False) as task: vendor = task.driver.vendor vendor._continue_deploy(task, **kwargs) cleanup_vmedia_boot_mock.assert_called_once_with(task) continue_deploy_mock.assert_called_once_with(task, **kwargs) set_boot_device_mock.assert_called_once_with(task, boot_devices.DISK, persistent=True) self.assertEqual(states.ACTIVE, task.node.provision_state) self.assertEqual(states.NOSTATE, task.node.target_provision_state)

commit_message:
Change L3 agent AdvancedService class to be non-singleton

The idea behind the AdvancedServices (Metadata, *aaS) services
to be singletons was to (1) offer a way to get an instance of such
a service in a convinient manner, and to (2) ensure that only one
service registered per service type.

(1) Since the AdvancedService.instance method required an instance
of a L3 agent, this point was kind of missed. If you have a L3 agent
instance in your hand, just use it to access the service you're looking
for.

(2) This is now fulfilled by asserting that only one driver is registered
(per type) in the .add method.

The motivation to make them non-singletons is that:
a) They don't need to be
b) The code is simplified this way
c) I've been facing crazy issues during functional testing where we're
   constantly instantiating L3 agents, and the (singleton) metadata
   service was referencing the wrong configuration object. The service
   was re-initialized during a test, screwing up the configuration of
   other mid-run tests.

Related-Bug: #1425759
Change-Id: I199f6a967c64e921624b397fa5b7dfc56572d63a

commit_message:
Adds line ranges, DRYs code, fixes #nosec

This adds line ranges instead of just the line the warning starts on. Shuffle
some code around into methods so we can DRY up the code. Since we now have line
ranges, the #nosec flag can be found accross lines so it's no longer required
that #nosec be on the line that warning starts.

Change-Id: Id63cf0fa5d9882eec7c6d388054bc678fb6e0457
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bandit refs/changes/17/158517/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def lines_with_context(line_range_list, context, max_line_no): worker = sorted(line_range_list) complete = set() # add lines list is on for l in worker: complete.add(l) # add lines before warning if (worker[0] - context) <= 0: for l in range(1, worker[0]): complete.add(l) else: for l in range(worker[0] - context, worker[0]): complete.add(l) # add lines after warning (+1 because of range behavior) if (worker[-1] + context) > max_line_no: for l in range(worker[-1], max_line_no + 1): complete.add(l) else: for l in range(worker[-1], worker[-1] + context + 1): complete.add(l) return sorted(list(complete))
deleted_lines: def mid_range(mid, count): if count == 1: return range(mid, mid + 1) diff = count / 2 if count % 2 == 0: start = mid - diff stop = mid + diff else: start = mid - diff stop = mid + diff + 1 if start < 1: stop = stop + (start * -1) + 1 start = 1 return range(start, stop)

commit_message:
Add documentation for exec, yaml, jinja2 plugins

Adding detailed documentation, with examples, on why things are bad and the
correct way to fix the warnings. Right now, this is just a knowledge base, but
eventually it would be nice to have these docs tied into the report via a URL.

Change-Id: I05d0f07624425e8505fcd97d94ce8a966c86bc0c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bandit refs/changes/83/158783/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
yaml.load() ===================== The [PyYaml docs](http://pyyaml.org/wiki/PyYAMLDocumentation#LoadingYAML) have details on why using ```yaml.load()``` with untrusted user data is very scary. ```yaml.load()``` can lead to remote code execution - ```yaml.safe_load()``` should be used whenever parsing untrusted YAML. ### Incorrect We'll use [Paul McMillan's gist](https://gist.github.com/PaulMcMillan/c4d560471dd529fdf9f3) to demonstrate why ```yaml.load()``` is scary. We start by defining a few things for our exploit, starting with ```exploit.py``` will look like: ```python print 'WINNA WINNA' ``` In order to get ```yaml.load()``` to properly execute our Python, we have to do some careful encoding. ```python encoded = ("eval(compile('%s'.decode('base64'), '<string>', 'exec'))" % exploit.encode('base64').replace('
', '')) ``` After executing the above, our ```encoded``` variable looks like: ```"eval(compile('cHJpbnQgIldJTk5BIFdJTk5BIgo='.decode('base64'), '<string>', 'exec'))"``` Next, we build the actual YAML object: ```python yaml_object = ('
upgrade_helper: !!python/object/apply:eval ["%s",]
' % encoded) ``` This results in ```yaml_object``` looking like: ``` '
upgrade_helper: !!python/object/apply:eval ["eval(compile('cHJpbnQgIldJTk5BIFdJTk5BIgo='.decode('base64'), '<string>', 'exec'))",]
' ``` We then take that ```yaml_object``` and print it to a file ```exploit.yaml```, it will look like: ``` upgrade_helper: !!python/object/apply:eval ["eval(compile('cHJpbnQgIldJTk5BIFdJTk5BIgo='.decode('base64'), '<string>', 'exec'))",] ``` Ok, all the setup is done. All we need to do now is ```yaml.load(open("exploit.yaml").read())```. We can see from the output that our ```print``` was executed and ```WINNA WINNA``` was printed to STDOUT: ```console >>> yaml.load(open("exploit.yaml")) WINNA WINNA ``` ### Correct Use ```yaml.safe_load()``` instead of ```yaml.load()```. In the PoC above, if we try to load ```exploit.yaml``` via ```safe_load()``` we get the following error: ``` >>> yaml.safe_load(open("exploit.yaml")) Traceback (most recent call last): ... yaml.constructor.ConstructorError: could not determine a constructor for the tag 'tag:yaml.org,2002:python/object/apply:eval' in "exploit.yaml", line 1, column 17 ``` ## Consequences * Remote code execution ## References * http://pyyaml.org/wiki/PyYAMLDocumentation#LoadingYAML * https://gist.github.com/PaulMcMillan/c4d560471dd529fdf9f3

commit_message:
Add check for secret=True on oslo password options

Anywhere oslo.config is used to register an option for a password,
Bandit needs to check whether its marked secret.

https://github.com/hyakuhei/OSSG-Security-Practices/blob/master/sensitive_config_file_options.md

Change-Id: I77ed0d50e004c41a685dac5c647b2129de8bc198

commit_message:
Add echo function

Is intended to be used for debugging like this:
$a = 'test'
echo($a, 'My string')
$b = [1,2,3]
echo($b, 'My array')
> 2015/02/10 21:43:26.939: My string (String) "test"
> 2015/02/10 21:43:26.040: My array (Array) ["1", "2", "3"]

Like 'notice' function but better

Change-Id: I0efb98a34b8d955c0703719c534c9dff912dcee9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/10/154610/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'time' require 'pp' Puppet::Parser::Functions::newfunction(:echo, :doc => <<-EOS Output the inspected value of the variable and its type. Example: $a = 'test' $b = ["1", "2", "3"] $c = {"a"=>"1", "b"=>"2"} $d = true $f = { "b" => { "b" => [1,2,3], "c" => true, "d" => { 'x' => 'y' }}, 'x' => 'y', 'z' => [1,2,3,4,5,6]} echo($a, 'My string') echo($b, 'My array') echo($c, 'My hash') echo($d, 'My boolean') echo($e, 'My undef') echo($f, 'My structure') 2015/02/10 21:43:26.939: My string (String) "test" 2015/02/10 21:43:26.939: My array (Array) ["1", "2", "3"] 2015/02/10 21:43:26.939: My hash (Hash) {"a"=>"1", "b"=>"2"} 2015/02/10 21:43:26.940: My boolean (TrueClass) true 2015/02/10 21:43:26.940: My undef (String) "" 2015/02/10 21:43:26.940: My structure (Hash) {"b"=>{"b"=>["1", "2", "3"], "c"=>true, "d"=>{"x"=>"y"}}, "x"=>"y", "z"=>["1", "2", "3", "4", "5", "6"]} EOS ) do |argv| value = argv[0] comment = argv[1] timestamp = Time.now.strftime("%Y/%m/%d %H:%M:%S.%3N") message = "(#{value.class}) #{value.pretty_inspect}" if comment message = "#{comment} #{message}" end message = "#{timestamp}: #{message}" puts message end

The exist logic in nova.conf about set up "metadata_listen" and "
metadata_listen_port"  options for nova metadata api is only

commit_message:
Remove check for metadata_listen* option

Remove "if" check for "metdata_listen" and "metadata_listen_port"
in nova.conf.erb to fix only enabled_apis inlcude "metadata" can
set those two options issue.

Change-Id: Ibb9cc65bfcc491eb7ed924138ecac5d7c9c983d7
Closes-bug: #1418797
